results.title: Hunt for the Wilderpeople
results.brief_description: Ricky is a defiant young city kid who finds himself on the run with his cantankerous foster uncle in the wild New Zealand bush. A national manhunt ensues, and the two are forced to put aside their differences and work together to survive.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

results.title: Hunt for a cancer killer
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer, Michael Sklar and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: A graphic account of science’s determined search for a chemical cure for cancer, outlining the promising work being done in the field of antibiotics. Includes interviews with scientists and visits to scientific laboratories and hospitals where tests and experiments are being carried out to produce a cancer-killing compound without harming healthy tissues.

results.title: Hunt
results.creator_credit: David Deverell and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
A hunting trip turns into a deadly manhunt, touching on themes of man’s relationship to his environment, animals and other people. Adapted from a story by Richard Connell.

results.title: Hungry minds
results.brief_description: A documentary report of the intellectual starvation in countries ravaged by WWII. Schools are now lost in the rubble with homes, hospitals and churches; children gather knowledge of the world from the black markets and the refuse dumps, roving in gangs through the litter of civilisation. From mute faces, eyes stare hungrily, marking the desolation war has wrought in minds as well as bodies. It is here that a beginning must be made: textbooks, writing materials, research equipment, and a thousand other tools of knowledge are needed to break apathy and hostility, and to open young minds to the promise of a peaceful world.

results.title: Hungry i reunion
results.brief_description: This documentary tells the story of the 1980 reunion of some of the entertainers who performed at San Francisco’s “Hungry i” nightclub during the 50s and 60s. The “Hungry i” was a place where the beatniks and bohemians of the day used to gather to see and hear a variety of singers, musicians and stand-up comedians perform their talents on stage, including Lenny Bruce, the Kingston Trio, the Limeliters, Stan Wilson, Jonathan Winters, Bill Cosby among others. Entrepeneur and owner of the nightclub, Enrico Banducci, provided many of these performers an opening to becoming internationally recognised and it is at this reunion they are able to pay homage to the nightclub and its owner. Through interviews, personal reminiscings, stills, archival footage and live on-stage performances, the film presents an inside look at a time and place although long gone is certainly not forgotten. Also features Maya Angelou, Don Asher, Phyllis Diller, John Sebastian, the Hungry i Reunion Trio, Bill Dana. Inspired by the novel “Honeycomb, ballad of a north beach caberet” by Don Asher.

results.title: Hungry Horace [ZX Spectrum computer game]
results.creator_credit: Melbourne House, Psion Software and Beam Software
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette and cover in a plastic cassette case
results.brief_description:
Hungry Horace offered gameplay based of the popular arcade game Pac-Man. It was celebrated as the first arcade game for the Spectrum. It was one of the few Spectrum games that were also available in ROM format. It formed part of the Horace series, which included Horace Goes Skiing and Horace and the Spiders and the unpublished Horace to the Rescue.

Horace is a blue blob with arms and legs, who wanders around a maze, picking the flowers, collecting fruit and avoiding the park guards, who are out to capture him. He is able to momentarily scare the guards, making them vulnerable, by ringing a bell in the maze. If Horace is able to escape capture and leave the maze, he moves to the next, more challenging level.

Source: Play It Again website:
http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/hungry-horace-orginal-spectrum/

Last accessed: 17/05/2021

Original game developed by Beam Software and Psion Software. Published in 1982 by Melbourne House.

results.title: Hungry Horace  for Commodore 64
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette and cover in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Hungry Horace [computer game]. Hungry Horace is a top down single player arcade game similar to Pac Man. Players control Horace through a maze collecting flowers and guards lunches while avoiding capture by the park guards. Horace can ring alarms and frighten guards from the park. If Horace is caught three times, he is thrown out of the park and the game ends.

If Horace is caught three times, he is thrown out of the park and the game ends.

results.title: Hungry Ghosts
results.creator_credit: Zi Zhong Wang, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
During Adelaide’s Chinese cultural week in 1988 a group of puppeteers from Adelaide’s sister city of Penang were invited to present one of their plays in honour of the Festival of Hungry Ghosts which fell at this time. The program shows their ritualistic preparations and some of the other festivities which took place.

results.title: Hungry angels
results.creator_credit: Marcel Reichenbach, Carlos M. Monson Malice and Reimon Productions
results.brief_description: Instructional film dealing with issue of malnutrition. Follows cases of three children - Maria, born to country peasants; Pedro, child of an urban single mother; and Carlos, the baby of a middle-class couple. As a result of poverty and ignorance, the first two children grow up constantly ill with dysentry and other ailments until, several years later, they are taken to hospital, close to death. The third child is fed well,has regular checkups and grows up healthy and happy.

results.title: Hunger nation
results.brief_description: This flash animation creates a dismal vision of the future. Effective use of repetition, perspective and scale creates the illusion of depth immersing the audience in an apocalyptic world. A skilfully restrained yet multilayered sound design combines with visual composition revealing confident use of the Flash program.
